cocktails.name: Moscow Mule
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a tall cocktail glass or mule mug with ice and gently stir to combine.
cocktails.glass: Tall cocktail glass or mule mug
history: The Moscow Mule is widely traced to 1941 in Los Angeles, where it emerged from a collaboration between a vodka distributor, a ginger beer producer, and a bar owner.
The copper mug became a defining part of the drink’s identity and helped it stand out visually, playing a major role in its popularity.
The drink is often cited as one of the cocktails that helped popularize vodka in the United States after World War II.

cocktails.name: Screwdriver
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a tall collins glass with ice.
history: The Screwdriver rose to popularity in the mid-20th century, particularly during World War II, when spirits were commonly mixed with orange juice.
The story that it was stirred with an actual screwdriver is widely told, though the exact origin of the name remains uncertain.
In many countries, it’s simply referred to as “vodka and orange,” highlighting its straightforward nature.

cocktails.name: Sea Breeze
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a rocks glass full of ice.
history: The modern Sea Breeze (vodka, cranberry juice, grapefruit juice) is recognized as an official International Bartenders Association cocktail.
Versions of the drink gained popularity during the mid-20th century alongside cranberry juice marketing campaigns.
It belongs to a family of “Breeze” cocktails that share a vodka-and-cranberry base with different secondary juices.

cocktails.name: Bay Breeze
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a rocks glass full of ice.
history: The Bay Breeze is closely related to the Sea Breeze, swapping grapefruit juice for pineapple juice.
It’s sometimes referred to as a “Hawaiian Sea Breeze” in older references.
The drink became popular as part of the broader wave of easy-drinking vodka cocktails in the late 20th century.

cocktails.name: White Russian
cocktails.method: Combine vodka and coffee liqueur in a rocks glass full of ice. Float the cream over top of the cocktail.
history: The White Russian gained major pop-culture fame after appearing repeatedly in the 1998 film The Big Lebowski.
In the movie, the drink is often called a “Caucasian,” a nickname that entered pop vocabulary afterward.
Despite its name, the cocktail does not originate in Russia and is instead a cream-based variation on earlier vodka drinks.

cocktails.name: Classic Vodka Martini
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a martini or coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Dirty Vodka Martini
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a martini or coupe glass.
cocktails.notes: Specific build can be debated; this is one option.

cocktails.name: Espresso Martini
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake well and strain into a martini or coupe glass.
history: The Espresso Martini was created in London in the 1980s by bartender Dick Bradsell.
Its origin story is commonly linked to a request for a drink that would energize and intoxicate at the same time.
The three-coffee-bean garnish is a long-standing presentation tradition associated with the drink.

cocktails.name: Cosmopolitan
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake well and strain into a martini or coupe glass.
cocktails.notes: Triple Sec suggestion: DeKuyper for lower tier, Cointreau for more upscale.
history: The modern Cosmopolitan is widely credited to a New York bartender in the late 1980s.
It became a defining cocktail of the 1990s, strongly associated with urban nightlife and cocktail culture.
Its global fame was cemented through repeated appearances on television, particularly in Sex and the City.

cocktails.name: Lemondrop Martini
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a martini or coupe glass.
cocktails.garnish: Sugar rim and lemon peel or wheel
cocktails.notes: Triple Sec suggestion: DeKuyper for lower tier, Cointreau for more upscale.
history: The Lemon Drop Martini was created in the 1970s in San Francisco.
Its flavor profile was inspired by lemon drop candy, which influenced both the name and the sweet-tart balance.
The sugar-rimmed glass became a signature feature of the drink.

cocktails.name: Gin Gimlet
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.
history: The Gimlet is traditionally made with gin and lime cordial and has roots in early 20th-century British drinking culture.
It is referenced in classic literature, helping cement its place in cocktail history.
Early written references to the drink date back to the late 1920s.

cocktails.name: Southside
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake well and fine strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Eastside
cocktails.method: Muddle cucumber and mint in a mixing tin. Add remaining ingredients with ice, shake well, and strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Bees Knees
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a stemmed cocktail glass.
history: The Bee’s Knees is a Prohibition-era cocktail combining gin, lemon juice, and honey.
The phrase “bee’s knees” was popular slang at the time meaning “the best.”
Honey was often used in Prohibition cocktails to soften the taste of lower-quality spirits.

cocktails.name: French 75
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients except sparkling wine in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass or champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine.
history: The French 75 is named after a French 75mm field artillery gun used during World War I.
The drink blends gin with lemon, sugar, and sparkling wine, making it both celebratory and potent.
Its name reflects the drink’s reputation for delivering a strong effect.

cocktails.name: Gin & Tonic
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a tall collins glass full of ice.

cocktails.name: Negroni
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Gin Martini
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a martini or coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Hanky Panky
cocktails.method: Combine all ingredients with ice. Strain up into cocktail glass.
history: The Hanky Panky was created by Ada “Coley” Coleman, head bartender at London’s Savoy Hotel.
It is one of the earliest well-known cocktails created by a woman bartender.
The name came from a guest’s enthusiastic reaction to the drink’s unexpected flavor.

cocktails.name: Last Word
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Bramble
cocktails.method: Shake gin, lemon, and simple with ice. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice (crushed recommended). Slowly pour crème de mure over top.

cocktails.name: Tommy’s Margarita
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Tequila Sunrise
cocktails.method: Combine tequila and orange juice in a tall collins glass over ice. Slowly pour grenadine to sink at the bottom.
cocktails.garnish: Orange half wedge or wheel and a cherry

cocktails.name: Ranch Water
cocktails.method: Shake tequila and lime with ice, strain into a collins glass over fresh ice. Top with soda water and gently stir.
cocktails.garnish: Salt rim and lime wedge or wheel

cocktails.name: Classic Margarita
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Classic Paloma
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a tall cocktail glass over ice and gently stir, adding more ice as needed.

cocktails.name: Mexican Firing Squad
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice and shake. Strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass.

cocktails.name: El Diablo
cocktails.method: Shake all ingredients except ginger beer with ice. Strain over fresh ice in a collins glass and top with ginger beer.

cocktails.name: Naked and Famous
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Oaxaca Old Fashioned
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Mezcal Margarita
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Whiskey Sour
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Gold Rush
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Paper Plane
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: New York Sour
cocktails.method: Shake ingredients except red wine with ice. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Float red wine over top.

cocktails.name: Bourbon Highball
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a collins glass with ice, gently stirring to combine.

cocktails.name: Bourbon Lemonade
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a collins glass with ice.

cocktails.name: Bourbon Palmer (Reverend Palmer)
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a tall collins glass with ice and gently stir to combine.

cocktails.name: Kentucky Mule
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a tall collins glass or mule mug with ice and gently stir to combine.

cocktails.name: Coffee Old-Fashioned
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients with ice and stir. Strain over a large cube.

cocktails.name: Basil Hayden 75
cocktails.method: Shake ingredients except sparkling wine with ice and strain into a coupe glass. Top with sparkling wine.

cocktails.name: Bourbon Collins
cocktails.method: Shake Basil Hayden, lemon, and simple with ice. Strain into a collins glass over fresh ice. Top with soda water and gently stir.

cocktails.name: Old Fashioned
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Boulevardier
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Manhattan
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a coupe or nick and nora glass.
cocktails.glass: Coupe or nick and nora glass

cocktails.name: Black Manhattan
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir to chill and strain into a coupe or nick and nora glass.
cocktails.glass: Coupe or nick and nora glass

cocktails.name: Sazerac
cocktails.method: Rinse a chilled cocktail glass with absinthe and discard. Stir rye, simple syrup, and bitters with ice to chill. Strain into the prepared glass.
cocktails.garnish: Lemon peel (express oils and discard peel)

cocktails.name: Japanese Highball
cocktails.method: Fill a tall cocktail glass with ice. Pour whisky and gently stir to chill. Add soda water and stir again to combine.

cocktails.name: Daiquiri
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Hemingway Daiquiri
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake well and strain into a coupe glass.

cocktails.name: Mojito
cocktails.method: Combine ingredients except soda water in a mixing tin with ice. Hard shake and double strain into a tall cocktail glass over fresh ice. Top with soda.
